means.word_mean: 1. insect whose female has a saw-like ovipositor for inserting eggs into the leaf or stem tissue of a host plant

auth_sentence.content: When disturbed, the larvae of most sawfly species adopt an S-shaped pose, often raising their rear ends and waving them about.
auth_sentence.res_content: When disturbed, the larvae of most sawfly species adopt an S-shaped pose, often raising their rear ends and waving them about.

auth_sentence.content: Infestations of sawfly larvae often defoliate plants although infestations are usually localised and rarely devastating.
